description: From Latin noun of process crucifīxiō, from perfect passive participle crucifīxus (“fixed to a cross”), from crux (“cross”) + fīgō.

definitionGroups.group: An execution by being nailed or tied to an upright cross and left to hang there until dead.

entries.meaning: (Christianity, often capitalized) The death on the Cross of Christ.
(military, historical, colloquial) The military punishment of being tied to a fixed object, often with the limbs in a stretched position.
(figuratively) An ordeal, terrible, especially malicious treatment imposed upon someone.
examples: The suspects' hostile interrogation amounted to a public crucifixion.
